intro: Girardinia diversifolia subsp. ciliata, commonly known as the hairy leaf girardinia, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
